Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can depict a basic string telephone with two students at either end, using some recognizable elements (e.g., cups and a line for the string).
The student can include basic notes or labels, such as labeling the cups and string, to indicate the components of the string telephone.
CANNOT: The student may not correctly illustrate the concept of sound traveling along the string (e.g., they might not show how sound waves move or misunderstand how sound is transferred).

The student might omit or incorrectly depict features that demonstrate the ability to communicate using sound over a long distance (e.g., not stretching the string taut or failing to show it connects the two cups effectively).

The student may not clearly depict or label how the device solves the communication problem, such as omitting a label explaining sound transmission or adding incorrect explanations (e.g., thinking sound is carried through the air when the cup is tapped).
